intro: Pinelianthe leochilus, commonly known as the golden pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dense, woolly foliage and bright yellow ray florets that attract pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance contribute to its ornamental value in horticulture.
